name: NPR
text:
Louis DeJoy promised some top election officials today that mailed ballots would be the Postal Service's top priority this fall.

He said a new task force will look at each mail processing plant and assess what it may need to handle high volumes of mail.
https://t.co/Yn3knginNs

name: NPR
text:
‚ÄúPeople are rightfully angry and exhausted. And after the murder of Breonna and George and Ahmaud and so many others, it‚Äôs no wonder people are taking to the streets, and I support them,‚Äù Kamala Harris said Thursday.
https://t.co/HS7HCNlM36

name: NPR
text: WATCH LIVE: The fourth night of the Republican National Convention. https://t.co/Ph8knRnKTF

name: NPR
text:
It‚Äôs the final day of #RNC2020. Speakers will include Ivanka Trump, Mitch McConnell and Ben Carson ‚Äî with President Trump closing out the night.

Watch live and follow along for fact-checks and analysis üëá https://t.co/dYFdCp8YSm

name: NPR
text:
President Trump is expected to announce a $750 million deal to purchase 150 million rapid coronavirus tests from Abbott Laboratories, according to a White House official.
https://t.co/crRxDCp4M6

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden, who has largely campaigned virtually since mid-March, says he plans to visit some key battleground states after Labor Day, saying his in-person campaigning will be ‚Äútotally consistent with being responsible.‚Äù
https://t.co/U4GfB8AAFG

name: NPR
text:
FEMA says it is working to assess the damage from Hurricane Laura and distribute aid to people in need ‚Äî while taking precautions to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
https://t.co/YhJxiYdyV9

name: NPR
text:
Speaking at #RNC2020, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy offered praise for President Trump, saying he believes "the best is yet to come."

 He also touched on facing an invisible enemy ‚Äî without naming the coronavirus directly. https://t.co/XfAYErTWuo

name: NPR
text:
White House aide Ja‚ÄôRon Smith praised President Trump, saying he's been dedicated to issues that matter to Black Americans.

Trump won just 8% of the Black vote in 2016, and his campaign has been trying to boost those margins‚Äîbut it won't be easy. #RNC2020
https://t.co/yUJhlxrSp9

name: NPR
text:
The daughter of slain police captain David Dorn criticized his widow for using his death to promote Trump at the #RNC, telling The St. Louis American: "He would not want his legacy to be for his death to be used to further Trump‚Äôs law-and-order agenda.‚Äù
https://t.co/TRVXc4JQjx

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: Republicans have repeatedly, falsely claimed Joe Biden is a socialist ‚Äî a charge the GOP has leveled at Democrats for decades.

Here's what socialism actually is.
https://t.co/vGHjt6MsYr

name: NPR
text:
We're fact-checking President Trump's address at the #RNC2020.

Watch live and follow our annotations üëá
https://t.co/df56JaXv32

name: NPR
text:
The alleged Kenosha shooter ‚Äî¬†a 17-year-old "Blue Lives Matter" supporter ‚Äî has been charged with five felony counts and one misdemeanor.

That includes first-degree intentional homicide, which is punishable by life in prison. https://t.co/zZU8Nz8gtU

name: NPR
text: More than half a million people were ordered to flee Texas and Louisiana due to Hurricane Laura ‚Äî and now some experts are warning mass evacuations could be responsible for a new wave of coronavirus infections. https://t.co/oNIBV7Ddfz

name: NPR
text:
Some worry the Trump administration could announce an "October surprise" ‚Äî declaring a vaccine works before it has passed scientific muster to enhance his reelection chances.

FDA officials maintain all their decisions are based in science, not politics.
https://t.co/qpPu9lKgPn

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: President Trump says if re-elected he will "again build the greatest economy in history."

While the unemployment rate fell to just 3.5% before the pandemic, the economy grew 2.2% last year ‚Äî roughly on par with the pace over the past decade. https://t.co/0UrSWaUBDl https://t.co/TUM8r6UAox

name: NPR
text:
Analysis: Four years ago, President Trump promised that Mexico would pay to build a wall he wanted along the U.S.-Mexico border.

The administration says 275 miles have been built.

Mexico has not paid a penny. https://t.co/3QG5HnwSeZ https://t.co/eSkQSWYv7N

name: NPR
text:
Analysis: President Trump emphasized the U.S.'s COVID-19 case-fatality rate at the #RNC2020.

But this is seen by public health experts as an unreliable marker of the success or failure of a country‚Äôs efforts. https://t.co/XyTVApGWj2 https://t.co/VCbNcjouDO

name: NPR
text:
Analysis: President Trump boasted that the U.S. added 9 million jobs over the past 3 months.

That‚Äôs fewer than half the 22 million jobs that were lost in March and April ‚Äî as the economy slid into the deepest recession since the Great Depression. https://t.co/mmOg3NVzag https://t.co/Q3VUX2RmnD

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: President Trump claimed Joe Biden would hike taxes for "almost all American families." That's not true.

Biden's plan is primarily focused on high-income households ‚Äî and he has insisted he won't raise taxes on income under $400,000. https://t.co/mVjiOuliNA https://t.co/nl9OlVTG4L

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: President Trump falsely claimed that Joe Biden has "vowed to oppose school choice and close all charter schools."

Trump has repeated this falsehood before. It is not a Biden position. https://t.co/rj4HIO5rbo https://t.co/LL8CRiki6R

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: President Trump claimed Joe Biden is "talking about taking the wall down."

Biden said he would cease additional construction of the border wall. 

He did not suggest he would tear down the existing wall on the southern border. https://t.co/PXpW558oa7 https://t.co/gv5lnrmzzt

name: NPR
text:
Fact Check: President Trump says the GOP will "very strongly protect patients with pre-existing conditions."

His own administration has asked the SCOTUS to strike down the entire Affordable Care Act ‚Äî which protects patients with pre-existing conditions. https://t.co/Hw3zxbgJwf https://t.co/qrEEZccFs0

name: NPR
text:
Analysis: President Trump again suggested Joe Biden wants to defund the police. That isn't true.

Biden has said he‚Ä¶ https://t.co/559mFaAPAa

name: NPR
text:
Analysis: President Trump suggested China wants Joe Biden to win.

The U.S. intelligence community said in a statement in August that China prefers President Trump not win re-election ‚Äî and that Russia is trying to undermine the Biden campaign. https://t.co/k2oOKNNHFO https://t.co/zQjyRhvUbL

name: NPR
text:
Our team of reporters and editors annotated President Trump's remarks at the #RNC2020 with fact-checks and analysis.
